data.title: City Planning Commission
data.meta_description: The Planning Commission administers the City's Zoning Ordinance to review development proposals. They also review and recommend ordinance text or zoning map changes to the City Commission.
data.text:
Applications

Planning a project? Use the links below for instructions and forms for all your project needs.

You can now apply for our Planning Commission applications online! For a list of online Planning Commission applications, click here.

Otherwise, you may download and complete an application from the list below. Please note, for many Planning Commission applications, you will need to complete the Owner Authorization form, which may be downloaded here.

Meeting Schedule

We meet the second (and fourth, as necessary) Thursday of each month, with public hearings beginning at 1:00 PM.

Space on Planning Commission agendas is on a first-come, first-served basis. Agendas often fill before the posted deadline.

Download Annual Meeting Schedule

Download Meeting Cancellation Notice (July 25, 2024)

Meeting Agendas

We use a third party application called Legislative Management to manage board meetings and agendas. You'll leave our site to see the calendar or review past meeting details. See more details below or learn How to Use Legislative Management.

Meetings and Agendas

Planning Commission Meeting Live Streams Page

You'll see a quick description of the commission and a list of its members at the top of the page. You can also find meeting minutes, agendas, and other important documents on this page.

Note: scroll near the bottom of the page. The meeting schedule, minutes, and agendas are below the listing of board members.

Location

City Hall

300 Monroe Ave. NW

City Commission Chambers, 9th Floor

Residency Requirement

Most members on this board must live within in Grand Rapids city limits. However, the Mayor may appoint one non-resident to the Commission.

Term Limits

Each memberâ€™s term, other than ex officio members, are appointed for 3 year terms that expire on the first Monday in January on the third year succeeding his or her appointment, or until his or her successor is appointed, whichever is later. Members, other than ex officio members, first appointed, are appointed to 1 year or 2 year terms so that, as nearly as possible, the terms of one-third of all members will expire each year.

Compensation

There is no compensation for members of this board.
